title: pyliblzma is failing to import lzma on debian stable (and may be elsewhere)
body:
on nd90 buildbot (http://smaug:8020/builders/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/builds/3338/steps/nosetests/logs/stdio)
```
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/datalad/metadata/search.py", line 40, in <module>
    from datalad.support.json_py import dump2fileobj as jsondump2file
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/datalad/support/json_py.py", line 14, in <module>
    import lzma
ImportError: /home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/venv-ci/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/lzma.so: undefined symbol: lzma_alone_encoder
```

from within that buildbot docker venv session:
```shell
$ /home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/venv-ci/bin/python -c 'import lzma'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
ImportError: /home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/venv-ci/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/lzma.so: undefined symbol: lzma_alone_encoder
$ ldd /home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/venv-ci/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/lzma.so 
	linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007ffde7ffb000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007f02aee5f000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6 (0x00007f02aeac1000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x0000557264799000)
$ apt-cache policy liblzma-dev
liblzma-dev:
  Installed: 5.2.2-1.2+b1
  Candidate: 5.2.2-1.2+b1
  Version table:
 *** 5.2.2-1.2+b1 500
        500 http://httpredir.debian.org/debian stretch/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
$ dpkg -l liblzma*
Desired=Unknown/Install/Remove/Purge/Hold
| Status=Not/Inst/Conf-files/Unpacked/halF-conf/Half-inst/trig-aWait/Trig-pend
|/ Err?=(none)/Reinst-required (Status,Err: uppercase=bad)
||/ Name           Version      Architecture Description
+++-==============-============-============-=================================
ii  liblzma-dev:am 5.2.2-1.2+b1 amd64        XZ-format compression library - d
un  liblzma-doc    <none>       <none>       (no description available)
ii  liblzma5:amd64 5.2.2-1.2+b1 amd64        XZ-format compression library
```

I thought it is the issue of outdated liblzma5, but that one seems to be the same as on a local system and it imports just fine there:

```shell
$> virtualenv --python=python2 venv-lzma          
Running virtualenv with interpreter /usr/bin/python2
New python executable in /tmp/venv-lzma/bin/python2
Also creating executable in /tmp/venv-lzma/bin/python
Installing setuptools, pkg_resources, pip, wheel...done.

$> venv-lzma/bin/pip install pyliblzma
Collecting pyliblzma
  Using cached pyliblzma-0.5.3.tar.bz2
Building wheels for collected packages: pyliblzma
  Running setup.py bdist_wheel for pyliblzma ... done
  Stored in directory: /home/yoh/.cache/pip/wheels/c0/1e/0b/ca8019b28cafea9e47394f33ab353744133efcc1410def31eb
Successfully built pyliblzma
Installing collected packages: pyliblzma
Successfully installed pyliblzma-0.5.3

$> venv-lzma/bin/python -c 'import lzma; print lzma'
<module 'lzma' from '/tmp/venv-lzma/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/lzma.so'>
```
